SitePage /2x-grid/.title: 2x Grid
SitePage /2x-grid/.description: The IBM grid is the framework for all the visual elements and typography. The grid gives you structure and guidance so you can focus on your creative idea.

SitePage /color/.title: Color
SitePage /color/.description: The IBM Color palette is blue at the core, expanding across color families and gradients, using specifications to represent mankind and machine in action.

SitePage /animation/classic-principles/.title: Classic principles
SitePage /animation/classic-principles/.description: Most animators are familiar with the 12 basic principles of animation. Although these principles originally applied to character animation, our unique interpretation of each one makes it decidedly relevant when applying motion to graphic forms.

SitePage /animation/overview/.title: Overview
SitePage /animation/overview/.description: Animation is a powerful communication tool. It brings our work to life, guides viewers through complicated problems, tells meaningful stories and helps make progress—from here to there, now to next, start to finish.

SitePage /animation/tips-and-techniques/.title: Tips and techniques
SitePage /animation/tips-and-techniques/.description: Every animation—from simple linework pictograms through expansive, high-fidelity 3D—requires a different approach and new solutions. However, the following guidance is universally applicable to every execution.

SitePage /data-visualization/charts/.title: Charts
SitePage /data-visualization/charts/.description: Charts are typically divided into categories based on their goals, aesthetics or visual features. Since charts can be versatile and used in different ways, details and features of these categories are explained and contextualized here. Use these best practices as you create data visualizations.

SitePage /data-visualization/overview/.title: Overview
SitePage /data-visualization/overview/.description: Data visualization is a powerful means to discover, understand and reveal important stories that live within vast amounts of information. To be effective, they need to stand out, be distinctive, be clear and deliver meaning while representing values and numbers accurately. We’ve synthesized a set of criteria that can help you achieve successful data visualization.

SitePage /help/faq/.title: FAQ
SitePage /help/faq/.description: The following are some of the most frequently asked questions about the IBM Design Language. Please check back often, as new FAQs will be added to this list.

SitePage /help/support/.title: Support
SitePage /help/support/.description: We want to help you apply the IBM Design Language both correctly and creatively. Learn about the approvals process and where you can find answers to specific questions.

SitePage /gallery/.title: Gallery
SitePage /gallery/.description: The IBM Design Language gallery displays examples of the vision of IBM designer Eliot Noyes that unity, not uniformity creates the correct total statement.

SitePage /ibm-logos/8-bar/.title: 8-Bar
SitePage /ibm-logos/8-bar/.description: The IBM logo is a major corporate asset with specific legal requirements. See lineage, positive and negative versions, color, third-party usage and more.

SitePage /ibm-logos/rebus/.title: Rebus
SitePage /ibm-logos/rebus/.description: The IBM logo is one of our most valuable corporate assets and is among the most recognized identities in the world. It's the tangible symbol of our brand.

SitePage /illustration/overview/.title: Overview
SitePage /illustration/overview/.description: Our illustrations take on many forms and ultimately have a job to do. They should always have a clear purpose, support content and guide a user to understand difficult concepts, products or services. Clear and simple illustrations help us provide meaningful engagement to our users.

SitePage /illustration/tips-and-techniqu.title: Tips and techniques
SitePage /illustration/tips-and-techniqu.description: Illustrations can move a viewer from one point of view to another instantly. Ways of seeing them vary from abstract to literal, from micro to macro and more. The intent of a piece helps determine a framework and canvas, while considered use of color provides deeper meaning. Use these tips and techniques to build powerful illustrations.

SitePage /philosophy/pov/.title: Point of view
SitePage /philosophy/pov/.description: Learn more about the IBM philosophy that good design is always good design, and good design is essential to building trust while delivering progress.

SitePage /philosophy/principles/.title: Principles
SitePage /philosophy/principles/.description: IBM Design principles are carefully considered, uniquely unified, expertly executed and positively progressive. Learn why to guide is to lead.

SitePage /photography/overview/.title: Overview
SitePage /photography/overview/.description: IBM photography sets transformational conversations in motion. Whether reporting, portraits or still life, learn how it's a direct reflection of the world..

SitePage /photography/tips-and-technique.title: Tips and techniques
SitePage /photography/tips-and-technique.description: When choosing or creating an IBM image, certain criteria should be considered. This guidance will help achieve the impression we’re looking for.

SitePage /typography/type-specs-ui/.title: Type specs UI
SitePage /typography/type-specs-ui/.description: The proper application of type to reflect the IBM brand requires an understanding of scale, style, setting and color. Learn more about Type Specs.

SitePage /typography/type-basics/.title: Type basics
SitePage /typography/type-basics/.description: Good typography starts with type basics tracking, leading, alignment and line length. Find guidance for best practices in the use of IBM IBM Plex®.

SitePage /typography/typeface/.title: Typeface
SitePage /typography/typeface/.description: Discover the patented IBM Plex® typeface. Learn about features, languages supported, open source licenses and where to get our unique corporate typeface.

SitePage /whats-new/.title: What’s new
SitePage /whats-new/.description: The IBM Design Language guidance, assets, and site experience are constantly evolving and improving. This page lists all major updates, changes, rollouts and release dates. Check back here to learn what’s new in the latest release.

SitePage /data-visualization/design/basi.title: Design
SitePage /data-visualization/design/basi.description: To make data visualization distinctive as IBM products, there are multiple elements, components and features to consider because, together, they all contribute to a functional and effective representation of data. The following set of best practices and applications are helpful to isolate the different design aspects and to properly address them.

SitePage /data-visualization/design/usag.title: Design
SitePage /data-visualization/design/usag.description: Taking our design philosophy from theory to practice, these examples demonstrate the IBM data visualization guidelines applied across product UI and marketing environments of all types.

SitePage /iconography/app-icons/design/.title: App icons
SitePage /iconography/app-icons/design/.description: App icons represent products, services, hero brands and third parties. Based on stroke, fill or IBM Plex® styles, they identify apps for users at a glance.

SitePage /iconography/app-icons/producti.title: App icons
SitePage /iconography/app-icons/producti.description: App icons are visual symbols that represent products or services. They allow users to identify apps at a glance while expressing our brand.

SitePage /iconography/app-icons/usage/.title: App icons
SitePage /iconography/app-icons/usage/.description: App icons represent products or services within web platforms and marketplaces. Find out how usage and color choices differ by native OS. See our gallery.

SitePage /iconography/pictograms/contrib.title: Pictograms
SitePage /iconography/pictograms/contrib.description: Pictograms are visual symbols used to represent ideas, objects, or narratives at a glance. They work well in presentations and marketing communications.

SitePage /iconography/pictograms/design/.title: Pictograms
SitePage /iconography/pictograms/design/.description: Pictograms are visual symbols used to represent ideas, objects, or narratives at a glance. They work well in presentations and marketing communications.

SitePage /iconography/pictograms/usage/.title: Pictograms
SitePage /iconography/pictograms/usage/.description: Pictograms are visual symbols used to represent ideas, objects, or narratives at a glance. They work well in presentations and marketing communications.

SitePage /iconography/ui-icons/contribut.title: UI icons
SitePage /iconography/ui-icons/contribut.description: Icons are visual symbols that represent ideas, objects, or actions. They draw from details in the Plex typeface, and communicate information at a glance.

SitePage /iconography/ui-icons/design/.title: UI icons
SitePage /iconography/ui-icons/design/.description: The style, strokes, perspective, corners and angles of IBM icons all echo our Plex(R) typeface. Use them to represent ideas, invite action or draw attention.

SitePage /iconography/ui-icons/usage/.title: UI icons
SitePage /iconography/ui-icons/usage/.description: Icons are important aids to the user experience. Employ icons strategically with careful view to sizing, alignment, clearance and color in usage.

SitePage /illustration/flat-style/design.title: Flat style
SitePage /illustration/flat-style/design.description: Flat style illustrations use basic geometric shapes to suggest people, objects, places and concepts using elements such as grid and color.

SitePage /illustration/flat-style/usage/.title: Flat style
SitePage /illustration/flat-style/usage/.description: Flat style illustrations use basic geometric shapes to suggest people, objects, places and concepts using elements such as grid and color.

SitePage /illustration/isometric-style/d.title: Isometric style
SitePage /illustration/isometric-style/d.description: Isometric style illustrations transform 2D objects using equal angles, color, light and shadow, showing the illusion of depth, substance and motion.

SitePage /illustration/isometric-style/p.title: Isometric style
SitePage /illustration/isometric-style/p.description: Isometric style illustrations have unique properties and can sometimes be difficult to achieve. The following production guidelines can help you through the technical details.

SitePage /illustration/line-style/design.title: Line style
SitePage /illustration/line-style/design.description: Line style illustrations use limited line weights and a small grid to convey concepts with precision and yet a wide latitude for expression.

SitePage /illustration/line-style/usage/.title: Line style
SitePage /illustration/line-style/usage/.description: Line style illustrations use limited line weights and a small grid to convey concepts with precision and yet a wide latitude for expression.

SitePage /infographics/infograms/.title: Infograms
SitePage /infographics/infograms/.description: Infograms provide real data depictions in the style of IBM pictograms. This type of information graphic works well for tertiary or marginal data in smaller spaces.

SitePage /illustration/people/.title: People
SitePage /illustration/people/.description: IBM serves a global audience of businesses, as well as social good through sustainability, ethical AI and racial equity initiatives. Our technology sits at the heart of our brand purpose—to be the catalyst that makes the world work better. Humanity is integral to our work, bringing together people and technologies to create outcomes larger than we could accomplish alone. We celebrate the vast diversity of personalities, cultures and abilities in an inclusive way through illustration guidance with an established aesthetic that’s identifiably IBM.

SitePage /infographics/technical-diagram.title: Technical diagrams
SitePage /infographics/technical-diagram.description: Learn how to build technical diagrams using nodes, connectors, icons and type elements with specific grid, color and spacing to depict a system’s structure, processes or hierarchy.

SitePage /infographics/technical-diagram.title: Technical diagrams
SitePage /infographics/technical-diagram.description: Build technical diagrams with clarity based on the IBM Design Language and Carbon. From depicting IT architecture to product documentation, use this guidance.

SitePage /illustration/isometric-style/u.title: Isometric style
SitePage /illustration/isometric-style/u.description: Isometric style illustrations have unique properties and can sometimes be difficult to achieve. The following production guidelines can help you through the technical details.
